decks.notes: The main strategy of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Grief, then bring them back to the battlefield with cards like Reanimate and Animate Dead. The deck also includes disruptive cards like Force of Will and Daze to protect your combo and disrupt your opponent's game plan. The key is to efficiently reanimate powerful creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier to overwhelm your opponent and secure victory. The deck also includes card draw and mana fixing to ensure consistency and reliability in executing the combo.

This deck focuses on disrupting your opponent's game plan with hand disruption and countermagic while also applying pressure with efficient threats like Murktide Regent and Nethergoyf. By controlling the game tempo and manipulating the opponent's hand, you aim to maintain board presence and advantage to secure a quick victory. The combination of card advantage, removal spells, and versatile threats allows for adaptability against a variety of decks, making it a solid choice for Legacy 1 vs 1 matches.

This deck focuses on controlling the opponent's tempo while also being aggressive with efficient creatures and removal spells. By utilizing disruptive cards like Daze and Stifle, along with powerful removal like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with creatures like Nethergoyf and Psychic Frog. The deck also includes some card advantage engines like Mishra's Bauble and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student to maintain resources. Wasteland helps to disrupt the opponent's mana base, giving the deck an additional edge in the tempo war.

This Grixis Aggro deck focuses on quickly playing and protecting efficient threats like Delver of Secrets and Dragon's Rage Channeler while disrupting the opponent with countermagic like Force of Will and Daze. The deck also utilizes cantrips like Ponder and Brainstorm to dig for answers and maximize card advantage. With an aggressive game plan and the ability to control the board, this deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain tempo to secure victory in Legacy 1 vs 1 matches.

The main concept of this deck is to ramp up mana quickly using Cloudpost, Planar Nexus, and Urza's Tower in order to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul and Ulamog. The deck also utilizes cards like Crop Rotation and Once Upon a Time to find key pieces quickly, while Karn, the Great Creator helps disrupt opponents and find additional threats. The inclusion of cards like Glimmerpost and Karakas provide additional utility and protection, while The Tabernacle at Pendrell Vale and Wasteland help control the opponent's board. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with giant creatures and powerful synergies.

This Eldrazi Aggro deck focuses on quickly deploying powerful Eldrazi creatures like Thought-Knot Seer and Glaring Fleshraker using acceleration from cards like Ancient Tomb and Lotus Petal. Chalice of the Void is used to disrupt opponent's spells, while Wasteland and Blast Zone help control the opponent's board. Once Upon a Time helps to find key pieces early in the game, and Eye of Ugin provides additional discounts on Eldrazi creatures. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with fast, high-impact threats and disrupt their game plan with disruptive elements like Chalice of the Void.

The main focus of this deck is to assemble a powerful combo using Mystic Forge to cast cards off the top of the library, along with key artifacts such as The One Ring, Manifold Key, and Karn, the Great Creator. The deck also includes powerful mana acceleration with cards like Grim Monolith and Lotus Petal, as well as utility lands like Urza's Workshop and Urza's Saga. The goal is to generate a fast and resource-efficient engine that can overwhelm the opponent with a combination of card advantage, mana generation, and disruptive threats.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly assemble the necessary combo pieces, primarily utilizing Doomsday to set up a winning sequence with Thassa's Oracle. The deck focuses on manipulating the library to ensure a successful resolution of the combo, including the use of cards such as Ponder, Brainstorm, and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student. Additionally, the deck includes disruptive elements like Force of Will and Daze to protect the combo and interact with the opponent. Ultimately, the goal is to execute the Doomsday combo efficiently and secure victory through the Oracle win condition.

The deck focuses on assembling the Painter's Servant and Grindstone combo to mill out the opponent's library. It uses cards like Agatha's Soul Cauldron, Goblin Engineer, and Goblin Welder to set up the combo quickly. Red Elemental Blast and Pyroblast provide disruption against control decks, while cards like Phyrexian Devourer and Chaos Defiler offer alternative win conditions. The deck also utilizes cards like Urza's Saga to tutor for key pieces and Ancient Tomb for fast mana acceleration. Overall, the main goal is to quickly and efficiently win through the powerful combo interaction.

The deck focuses on utilizing ramp cards like Gaea's Cradle and Noble Hierarch to accelerate mana production and cast powerful creatures like Wight of the Reliquary and Endurance. It also includes toolbox cards like Green Sun's Zenith and Elvish Reclaimer to search for answers or threats as needed. The deck can quickly generate a wide board presence or find combo pieces like Natural Order to finish off opponents. The combination of efficient creatures, mana acceleration, and versatile search options makes it a strong control deck in the Legacy format.
